Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is expected to be a crucial technology in future power generation due to its advantages of high efficiency, fuel adaptability, all-solid state, modular assembly, and low pollution.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: The Ni/YSZ (yttrium-stabilized zirconia) cermet is the most popular anode material in SOFCs.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: However, a major problem is that it can be easily oxidized, thus resulting in the decline of long-term stability and activity as an anode catalyst.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: A better performance of the Ni/YSZ cermet can be obtained by improving its microstructure as well as the Ni distribution in it.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: Interactions between Ni and the yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) (111) or oxygen-enriched YSZ(111) (YSZ+O) surface are studied in terms of the first-principles method based on the density functional theory with particular focus put on the activity of the Ni atom at the interface.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: The geometric and electronic structures of CO and O-2 on the Ni-1 (the single Ni atom)/YSZ and Ni-1/YSZ+O surfaces are also studied.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: It is found that the Ni atom tends to be adsorbed to O sites and away from the Y atoms on both the surfaces.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: The most favorable adsorption site is the oxygen vacancy, which has an adsorption energy of 2.85 eV. Compared with YSZ, the single Ni atom loses 1.06 electrons and is oxidized as Ni+ on YSZ+O, which produces a strong interaction between the Ni atom and YSZ+O. Strong adsorption is mainly attributed to the interaction between Ni 3d and O-u 2p orbitals.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: And the oxidation of Ni can lead to the decrease of electrocatalytic activity of the Ni catalyst.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: The d-band DOS (density of states) peaks of the Ni-1/YSZ+O are lower than that of the Ni-1/YSZ, and the corresponding d-band centers are shifted away from the Fermi level to lower energy with the epsilon(d) value of -3.69
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: eV; therefore the CO and O-2 adsorption is weakened.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: While the adsorption energy for CO on the Ni-1/YSZ+O (0.42 eV) is much lower than that on the Ni-1/YSZ surface (1.78 eV).
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: In addition, the adsorbed CO gains 0.07 electrons, less than those on the Ni-1/YSZ surface (0.34 e).
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: The adsorption energy of O-2 on Ni-1/YSZ+O also decreases (0.34 eV) and gains fewer electrons (0.24 e) as compared with the corresponding values (2.57 eV, 1.15 eV) on Ni-1/YSZ.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface

Sentencas: Results would improve our understanding on the mechanism of oxidation of Ni on the Ni/ YSZ anode of SOFCs and would be of great importance for designing highly active catalysts used for fuel cells.
Titulo: The first-principles study on the interaction of Ni with the yttria-stabilized zirconia and the activity of the interface
